Package me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder.drive.meccanum

Class Meccanum

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder.drive.meccanum.Meccanum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drive
    public class Meccanum
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drive
    Meccanum drivetrains are surprisingly annoying to work with, let me just say that now.

    As usual, all of the math behind this is available online. In this case, a lot of the meccanum control algorithm comes from the following site. (here)

    • Wheel 1: front-left
    • Wheel 2: front-right
    • Wheel 3: back-left
    • Wheel 4: back-right
     V_1 = V_d * sin(theta_d + PI/4) + V_theta (FL)
 V_2 = V_d * cos(theta_d + PI/4) - V_theta (FR)
 V_3 = V_d * cos(theta_d + PI/4) + V_theta (BL)
 V_4 = V_d * sin(theta_d + PI/4) - V_theta (BR)

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Method Detail

      • drive

        public void drive​(HeadingPoint start,
                  HeadingPoint end,
                  double power)
        Drive the robot between two points.

        This uses tangent functionality to determine angle and drive the robot based on that determined angle.

        Specified by:
        drive in interface Drive
        Parameters:
        start - the start point.
        end - the end point.
        power - the percent (0 to 1) of power the drivetrain should

      • drive

        public void drive​(double power,
                  double angle)
        Drive the robot - woot woot!

        Unlike the other drive method, this method just uses an inputted angle rather than having to generate an angle.

        Specified by:
        drive in interface Drive
        Parameters:
        power - the power at which the motors should operate.
        angle - the angle at which the motors should point.
